definition: surname Yi/abbr. for 伊拉克[Yi1 la1 ke4], Iraq/abbr. for 伊朗[Yi1 lang3], Iran

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.chinese: 现在《伊利亚特》的英文拼写是。

sentences.english: Conquering mobile will be harder than Iliad’s entry into broadband.
sentences.chinese: 伊利亚特征服移动通讯的难度将高于当初涉足宽带。

sentences.english: Homer's IliadMilton's Paradise Lost are epics.
sentences.chinese: 荷马的《伊利亚特》和弥尔顿的《失乐园》是史诗。

definition: Virgil's Aeneid (epic about the foundation of Rome)
Sophocles (496-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Oedipus the King
Euripides (c. 480-406 BC), Greek tragedian, author of Medea, Trojan Women etc
Mahābhārata, second great Indian epic after 羅摩衍那|罗摩衍那[Luo2 mo2 yan3 na4], possibly originally c. 4th century BC
Thucydides (c. 455 - c. 400 BC), Greek historian, author of the History of the Peloponnesian War
Aeschylus (c. 524 BC -c. 455 BC), Greek tragedian, author of The Persians, Seven against Thebes etc
Giovanni Boccaccio (1313-1375), Italian writer, poet, and humanist, author of Decameron 十日談|十日谈[Shi2 ri4 Tan2]
Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]
